thread.title: Corn fields in parts of Brazil at risk due to dry weather: report

title: Corn fields in parts of Brazil at risk due to dry weather: report
text:
April 20, 2018 / 7:14 PM / in 13 minutes Corn fields in parts of Brazil at risk due to dry weather: report Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SAO PAULO (Reuters) - Some corn fields in the southern part of Brazil are at risk of losses due to the lack of rains, with parts of Paraná, Brazil’s second largest corn producing state, at worse situation, grains consultancy AgRural said on Friday. FILE PHOTO: Corn imported from Brazil is stored at a warehouse in the terminal port of Portimex in Tuxpan, in Veracruz state, Mexico February 21, 2018. REUTERS/Henry Romero 
The consultancy said harvesting of the 2017/18 Brazil soy crop is 91 percent completed, compared to 92 percent at this time last year and 90 percent of a 5-year average. Reporting by Marcelo Teixeira; Editing by Susan Thomas
